channel.title: stochastic-differential-equations on YoungStatS
channel.description: Recent content in stochastic-differential-equations on YoungStatS

item.title: Log-modulated rough stochastic volatility models
item.description: Rough Volatility New insights about the regularity of the instantaneous variance obtained from realized variance data (see Gatheral, Jaisson, and Rosenbaum (2018), Bennedsen, Lunde, and Pakkanen (2021, to appear), Fukasawa, Takabatake, and Westphal (2019)), have inspired the development of so-called stochastic volatility models in the financial literature. In simple terms, such a model can be described by the following SDE \[\begin{equation} \label{eq:stoch-vol} dS_t = S_t \sqrt{v_t}dB_t, \end{equation}\] where the logarithm of the instantaneous variance process \(v\) behaves similarly to a fractional Brownian motion (fBm) with Hurst index \(0 < H < 1/2\).
